meanings.definition: Take property unlawfully from (a person or place) by force or threat of force.
meanings.sent1: The thief robs the store at night.
meanings.sent2: He robs the bank to get money.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky raccoon robs the picnic basket when no one is looking.
meanings.sent4: Time robs us of our youth, leaving only memories behind.
meanings.sent5: The storm robs the trees of their leaves, scattering them across the ground.

meanings.definition: Deprive someone of (something) by deceit or betrayal.
meanings.sent1: She robs her friend of the chance to win by cheating in the game.
meanings.sent2: The con artist robs the elderly couple of their life savings.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat robs the dog of its favorite toy, causing a playful chase.
meanings.sent4: The illness robs him of his strength, leaving him bedridden.
meanings.sent5: The fog robs the landscape of its colors, creating a mysterious atmosphere.

meanings.definition: Steal something from (someone) by using force or threats.
meanings.sent1: The bully robs the younger kids of their lunch money every day.
meanings.sent2: The pirate robs the sailors of their treasures on the high seas.
meanings.sent3: The clever fox robs the henhouse, outsmarting the farmer.
meanings.sent4: Fear robs us of our courage, making us hesitate in the face of challenges.
meanings.sent5: The fire robs the forest of its lush greenery, leaving behind charred remains.
